replies.body: Because Darius needs more reasons to be played already.

Whoa whoa, careful there guy Daddy Rito will call you toxic and ban you forever for being so terribly offensive. You can't hurt people in their hugbox!
R.I.P. Dunkey
Darius has a hugbox too... And he can't hurt you in it.... Wait no... I'm wrong... He still deals 50%. !#@$...

Don't get me wrong, Dunkey is awesome and i'm a proud subscriber. But don't pretend like some of the things he said is perfectly okay. I'm glad Dunkey moved on past league on legends. I'm trapped here forever sadly.

LOL Darius isn't even that good he is actually rather bad in a solo queue environment. In the last week he has averaged between a 45-48% win rate which means that you have a better chance of winning with him on the other team than yours. Additionally his win rate gets worse as rank increases to the point of him having a 39% win rate in masters+ which means the is very viable counter play to him if you take the time to learn it. People are so quick to call champions op instead of educating themselves on how to play against it. He was op before his nerf, i will agree with that, but i don't think he is even close to ban worthy anymore, and the numbers back up my claim.

the problem being is knowing how to out play him cause right now its really hard. Sure he is susceptible to kiting so whats that mean should i start playing ashe in the top lane for her perma slow and range.Cause you know in solo que if you do that and lose you get called a troll you do that and win you just started something other ppl wanna copy and then they lose with it cause they thought i can do what the other guy did and be fine not knowing he some player on the next lvl list
You mean won't.
It's don't lol. Dunkmaster Darius will never be on sale.

I bought just a few for RP when on sale. I bought one at full price RP; only one champ I ever saw made me say "I MUST PLAY WHOEVER JUST THREW THAT". This was the first time I saw the Mega Inferno Bomb come sailing in out of nowhere.
I'm reading on to see if you say whom was worth the RP as I start to visualize the amounts of deaths said "Mega Inferno Bomb come sailing in out of nowhere" I have had, really it's out of NOWHERE!!!
I have never bought a champion with IP, because it takes too long to play enough games for them. I own all champions and bought them all with RP when they were on sale. Kappa

I always find it rather amusing when people complain about grinding for IP (not that your doing that) to buy their champs when honestly playing the game is the goal and getting IP (at least for me) is just a perk that gives me more variety. I just find it the whole Pokemon attitude some people get a bit baffling is all. I'm interested in why some people get the Pokemon attitude to gotta get em all so PLEASE someone try to give me a reason why you (or a person you know) may do this cause I would love to read about it.

Don't know if anyone else has noticed this too but i just wanted to throw my personal opinion out there.

I agree with the majority of your argument, but there is a gameplay benefit to owning every champion. In draft pick, it allows you to trade more often. It's also worth pointing out that, if no one on your team owns the champion, it can't be banned. If no one on your team owns Yorick (just an example don't kill me), then they don't have to worry about banning him. Since you own every champion, it means that every champion can be banned, so it's more likely they'll ban something you weren't going to play anyway (unless you main Darius).
I lol'd at ban {{champion:83}}

For me, i bought most of my champs with IP, but I did buy a few with RP - reason? A) i do play ranked, and the ones i bought were primarily when i started to playing ranked to help round out my champion pool, and B) when im playing normals, i like having options to try different things. There are so many champs i own that I rarely play, but i like having them for the few times I do choose to. and C) every now and then i play ranked 5s with friends, and since some of my friends have some really out there champ pools, it pays to have every champ so we can trade around if need be.

Owning every champ isnt a need by any means, but its convenient and fun for multiple different queues. Personally I never really had the pokemon mentality (been playing pokemon for years and have never once caught them all or even really tried that hard to), so i cant explain that, but I can explain at least why people might choose to purchase champs on RP on occasion.
